intro: Gilia gilioides var. violacea, commonly known as the violet gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems, lance-shaped leaves, and a compact growth habit.
